post.body: Apparently, not. Now that's infatuation (http://is.gd/bOWl).
Certainly less expensive, and they rock the vaguely WesAndersonian Font.
I like my moleskine (http://is.gd/103F), but I'll probably break down and try the Field Notes, too.
Ahh. I'm off to the post office in a bit. So totally not looking forward to it. Maybe I can break the cycle of hate...
Really? In what way? Probably smells more like festering impatience, or pre-emptive self righteousness, no?
Congrats! What was the interview for?
Maybe you could ask them if you can skip Minnesota this year. :)
I agree, in principle, but given that the track also includes a few motherf@ckers (and it _is_ a real mess) it got the axe.
We're going for Christmas. I've been there before, but I haven't seen my niece yet.
Southampton. On the coast. A ferry's ride from the Isle of Wight.
Are you kidding? No. I bought him at (the) Target for my two month old niece. I'm making her a "mixtape" of lullabies now.
Damn. That sounds good.
Damn. If I'd known about the cookies, I might still be in Hartford.
Thanks. Work on that next tweet-up. Something in early January?
@bh_j Thanks. (Safe, um, arrivals(?) to you J.)
Pay it forward? What is this, some sort of pyramid scheme? http://is.gd/cXs4
No biggie, just back to NJ for the holidays. My mom's parents are coming in this afternoon, too.
@JamesPlankton Does sad-making fall under the protections of the Endangered Species Act? If so, will apologies suffice?
I was seriously considering postponing my departure so that I could catch the show tonight. Sorry. I wish you awesome-ness!
I thought watching "Rivers & Tides" would make me want to give up, but instead it's given me a new lease on my creative life.
Good luck with that. Aside from the forests leveled for "grazing," the water and grain diverted to overfeed livestock also sucks.
Whoops. Step 1: check. Step 2: Not so much.
Thanks. :) I'm leaving as soon as I eat "breakfast" and get my shite together. An hour or so?
is finally ready to brave the post office and send some Christmas pressies to his peeps in Southampton, UK.
wonders if @sashafrerejones has read this not-so-well-written-but-interesting-nonetheless article about "Hallelujah" (http://is.gd/4gf).
Freshly ripped scrap paper, ftw. 'Cuz if the little things don't do it for you, nothing else will.
is mildly tickled that spaz recognizes motherf@ckers as a command to send email to motherf-at-ckers. Dot com? Dot net? Dot info.
First major decision: is it worth including a 3-minute mess by Girl Talk just because it has a 2-second sample from "My So-Called Life"?
Caught up on tweets, about to make some mix CDs to supplement modest Christmas presents.
is dropping by Borders in Farmington to say hi to old peeps, NOT to get his old job back.
Dear Upstairs Neighbor: You must find some things to do that DO NOT involve dropping things on, or dragging things across the floor. Kthxby.
I must be of the hiber-natory sort.
Late supper with parents and grandparents. They're settling in to the "guest room" (my old room). I'm in my sister's room ("the office").
Back at the homestead. Caught up on tweets. Laundry awaits.
Simply having a wonderful Christmas time, yet again.
is loading his car full of dirty laundry and then hitting the road.
Apparently one of the jobs I applied for online was writing material for "adult entertainment" sites. Erm, no thanks.
Should I down the "airborne" before the toast and tea, or after?
http://twitpic.com/uz5n - Madhu on his chariot.
I need new windshield wipers. Otherwise, an uneventful journey.
